qas.question: When was did Washington University open its law school?
When did Washington University establish its medical school?

answers.text: the president of the Board of Trustees

qas.question: When did St. Louis Medical college affiliate itself with Washington University?
In what year was Robert Sommers Brookings born?
In what year was the St. Louis Medical College founded?
What was the first private sectarian law school west of the Mississippi River?
What was the first public law school west of the Mississippi River?
What was the first private sectarian school west of the Mississippi River?

context: In <a0_0><b4_0>1867<b4_0/><a0_0/>, the university opened the first private nonsectarian law school west of the Mississippi River. By <b5_0>1882<b5_0/>, <b6_0><b7_0><b8_0>Washington University<b8_0/><b7_0/><b6_0/> had expanded to numerous departments, which were housed in various buildings across St. Louis. Medical classes were first held at Washington University in <a1_0><a3_0>1891<a3_0/><a1_0/> after the St. Louis Medical College decided to affiliate with the University, establishing the School of Medicine. During the 1890s, Robert Sommers Brookings, <a2_0>the president of the Board of Trustees<a2_0/>, undertook the tasks of reorganizing the university's finances, putting them onto a sound foundation, and buying land for a new campus.
